name: Anterior inferior tibiofibular ligament (AITFL)
text: Anterior inferior tibiofibular ligament (AITFL) is a distal tibiofibular syndesmosis ligament that stabilizes the ankle mortise.

name: Interosseous ligament (distal tibiofibular)
text: Interosseous ligament of the distal tibiofibular syndesmosis provides primary restraint to tibiofibular diastasis.

name: Posterior inferior tibiofibular ligament (PITFL)
text: Posterior inferior tibiofibular ligament (PITFL) is a syndesmotic ligament that stabilizes the ankle mortise and resists posterior talar displacement.

name: Tibionavicular ligament
text: Tibionavicular ligament is part of the medial (deltoid) ankle complex and supports medial ankle stability.

name: Tibiocalcaneal ligament
text: Tibiocalcaneal ligament is part of the medial (deltoid) ankle complex and limits hindfoot eversion.

name: Anterior tibiotalar ligament
text: Anterior tibiotalar ligament is part of the deep deltoid complex and limits lateral displacement and external rotation of the talus.

name: Posterior tibiotalar ligament
text: Posterior tibiotalar ligament is part of the deep deltoid complex and stabilizes the medial ankle.

name: Anterior talofibular ligament (ATFL)
text: Anterior talofibular ligament (ATFL) is a lateral ankle ligament that limits inversion in plantarflexion.

name: Calcaneofibular ligament (CFL)
text: Calcaneofibular ligament (CFL) stabilizes the lateral ankle and subtalar joint, especially in neutral or dorsiflexion.

name: Posterior talofibular ligament (PTFL)
text: Posterior talofibular ligament (PTFL) is a lateral ankle ligament that limits posterior talar displacement.
